episodes.title: Suspected cult operating in Eastern Cape
episodes.description:
The South African Human Rights Commission is calling for an investigation into a suspected cult operating in New Brighton in the Eastern Cape. The group known as God’s Angels is reportedly targeting teenagers persuading them to abandon school and family. Newzroom Afrika's Sipha Kema is following developments on the story and has filed this report.


Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: Families in New Brighton in turmoil as children join a suspected cult
episodes.description:
Families in New Brighton in the Eastern Cape are in turmoil as their children are being drawn into a suspected cult known as God’s Angels. These teenagers, persuaded to abandon school and family, have followed the leader of the group into isolation near Gqeberha. Newzroom Afrika's Sipha Kema reports.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: Cult victims speakout
episodes.description:
Newzroom Afrika's Sipha Kema is in Gqeberha where she is speaking to victims of arrested self-acclaimed Nigerian prophet Timothy Omotoso. One victim says she was lured by her church leader to Omotoso in the belief that he is a "man of God".

Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: Alleged Eastern Cape cult leader still at large
episodes.description:
A suspected cult known as God’s Angels in New Brighton near Gqeberha, allegedly led by Simamkele Mhlophe, has drawn several teenagers from local schools into a life of isolation in the wilderness. Despite police intervention and desperate efforts by parents, Mhlophe remains at large. Newzroom Afrika's Sipha Kema reports from Westville informal settlement in Gqeberha.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: PANEL DISCUSSION | Dangers of cults in children's development
episodes.description:
Commission for the Promotion and Protection of the Rights of Cultural, Religious and Linguistic Communities spokesperson Mpiyakhe Mkholo and educational psychologist Tshepiso Matentjie discuss the dangers of cults in children's psychological development.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: Church cult: parents fear for their children's' lives
episodes.description:
Parents of children believed to be under the spell of a suspected cult called God’s Angels, in Gqeberha, Eastern Cape, fear for their well-being. The group's leader allegedly convinced several local teenagers to leave their homes and schools and join him in the wilderness. Police have returned a few of the youngsters to their families, but the cult leader continues to meet with some of them in secret. #Newzroom405's Sipha Kema speaks to one of the families.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: Religion's a big business in SA, hence cults - Frahm-Arp
episodes.description:
Families around New Brighton, Eastern Cape, claim that Simamkele Mhlophe, a leader of a 'cult movement' called God's Angels, has taken their children. Parents say the children are now refusing to return home since they started living with him. University of Johannesburg's professor of Christian studies Prof. Maria Frahm-Arp says it's easy for people to join religious cults as religion is a big business in South Africa.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: God's Angels a headache for New Brighton families
episodes.description:
Families in New Brighton in Gqeberha, Eastern Cape, are frustrated about a suspected cult called God's Angels. Leader Simamkele Mhlophe has allegedly convinced several teenagers to leave their homes and schools to join his group. Jesus It Voices' Apostle Thomas tells Sipha Kema that the person behind the church poached young men, especially those talented in preaching.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: God's Angels a headache for New Brighton families
episodes.description:
Families in New Brighton in the Eastern Cape are frustrated about a suspected cult called God's Angels. Leader Simamkele Mhlophe, has convinced several local teenagers to leave their homes and schools to join his group. Even though police have managed to bring some of the kids back, Mhlophe remains at large and continues to meet with some of them in secret. 

Newzroom Afrika's Sipha Kema has more.

episodes.title: CRL: KwaSizabantu mission operated within scope of freedom of religion
episodes.description:
Erika Bornman, survivor and author of 'Mission of Malice - my exodus from KwaSizabantu' reacts to the CRL report that finds that doctrines of the mission were within the scope of freedom of religion.



Tune into Newzroom Afrika DStv channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: True-crime series, Devilsdorp, receives five-star reviews
episodes.description:
Streaming service Showmax launched true-crime series, Devilsdorp in July to five-star reviews and a record breaking first four days. The four-part doccie series investigates the 11 Krugersdorp killings between 2012 and 2016, known as The Appointment Murders. It depicts how each of those crimes were linked to a satanic cult and how a group of Christians tried to help a witch escape.

Journalist and writer of the Devilsdorp series, Jana Marx, explains. 

Tune into Newzroom Afrika on DSTV channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: Survivors of cults and abuse open up
episodes.description:
As we continue to look at the rise of cults in South Africa, Thabo Mdluli speaks to the survivors of cults and abuse, Pastor Yolanda Bam and Mariejtie Bothma.

episodes.title: The rise of cults in South Africa
episodes.description:
Researchers are warning that the country might see a rise in the number of cults after the COVID-19 pandemic, citing the loss of family members and job losses as triggers making people more vulnerable to cults.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika, DSTV channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: The Kwasizabantu Mission leaders open up about the scandalous allegations against the church
episodes.description:
The Kwasizabantu Mission says it is confident that all the allegations of sexual abuse, money laundering, fraud, and cultism leveled against them will come out as false. The church spokesperson, Ruth Combrink is on the line with Ayanda Nyathi.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika on DSTV channel 405 for more.

episodes.description:
Shocking revelations continue to come out of the hearings into the #KwaSizabantu Mission, which has been accused of several serious abuse allegations. Newzroom Afrika's Sipha Kema has the details.

episodes.title: The Kwasizabantu mission in Kwazulu-Natal hosted a media tour
episodes.description:
The Kwasizabantu mission in Kwazulu-Natal has hosted a media tour, amid allegations that it is operating as a cult. For more on this story, our reporter Karinda Jagmohan reports.

episodes.title: Sipho Hlongwane relates a gruesome experience he endured at  Kwasizabantu Mission (Church)
episodes.description:
Officials visited the Kwasizabantu Mission in KZN to get an understanding of allegations of physical and sexual abuse, and corruption leveled against some leaders. Sipho Hlongwane a journalist who grew up at the church tells his story.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika on DSTV channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: Final day of CRL Commission hearings into allegations of abuse and cultism at Kwasizabantu mission
episodes.description:
Today marks the third and final day of CRL Commission hearings into allegations of abuse and cultism at the Kwasizabantu mission. #Newzroom405's Karinda jagmohan is there and will be bringing you the latest. 

Tune into #Newzroom405 for more.

episodes.title: CRL Commission hearings into Kwasizabantu Mission begins
episodes.description:
KZN church, Kwasizabantu Mission faces allegations of rape, human rights abuse, and money laundering. The CRL Commission will hold hearings on Monday. The Chair of the CRL Commission, David Mosoma gives more insight into the hearings.

Tune into Newzroom Afrika on DSTV channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: KwaSizabantu Mission's supporter says allegations are nothing but hearsay
episodes.description:
PK Odendaal who describes himself as a Christian belonging to the brotherhood of all Christians has come in defence of KwaSizabantu Mission Church which has come under fierce allegations of rape, money-laundering and cultism, exposed by News24. In a scathing open letter to the publication, Odendaal says the expose is nothing but a smear campaign that has not been backed by evidence or an independent investigation and that the allegations are nothing but hearsay. For more on this, Ayanda Nyathi is joined by PK Odendaal, who wrote this letter to News24. 

Tune into #Newzroom405 for more.

episodes.title: KwaSizabantu Mission victim Marietjie Bothma speaks out about the abuse she suffered
episodes.description:
Newzroom Afrika's Thami Ngubeni earlier spoke to Marietjie Bothma, who was a victim of abuse at the KwaSizabantu Mission in KwaZulu-Natal. 

Tune into #DSTV channel 405 for more.

episodes.title: CRL Rights Commission probes KwaSizabantu Mission Church
episodes.description:
The CRL Rights Commission is investigating allegations of human rights abuse against the KwaSizabantu Mission Church. For an update on the probe, Thami Ngubeni speaks to the commission's chairperson, Professor David Mosoma. 

Tune into #DSTV channel 405 for more.
